intro: Matricaria dichotoma, commonly known as the common yarrow, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring slender stems and a basal rosette of leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are arranged in flat-topped clusters, known as corymbs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a strong, aromatic scent. Matricaria dichotoma is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its antiseptic and anti-inflammatory effects.
